sections.heading: Access Items
sections.description: List items are indexed and you can access them by referring to the index number: Negative indexing means start from the end -1 refers to the last item, -2 refers to the second last item etc. You can specify a range of indexes by specifying where to start and where to end the range. When specifying a range, the return value will be a new list with the specified items. By leaving out the start value, the range will start at the first item: By leaving out the end value, the range will go on to the end of the list: Specify negative indexes if you want to start the search from the end of the list:

sections.heading: Check if Item Exists
sections.description: To determine if a specified item is present in a list use the in keyword:

code_blocks.notes: Check if "apple" is present in the list:
